generalInfo: As Beatles Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr celebrate turning 83 and 85 in 2025, join us for an eight-day tour through the bandâs history. Travel from London's recording studios to Liverpoolâs streets, discovering the places that shaped their sound. Visit the real Penny Lane and Strawberry Fields, feel the energy of the historic Cavern Club, and walk the famous Abbey Road crossing. Expert guides will bring to life the story of the four Liverpool lads who revolutionized music as you explore the iconic landmarks and hidden gems that defined their journey.

dayInfo.title: London - Walk in the Footsteps of Legends
dayInfo.description: Step off your flight into London's crisp morning air, where your private driver awaits to whisk you to your luxury hotel. After refreshing, join the steady rhythm of Abbey Road, where cars pause and pedestrians weave past you as you take your place on the world's most famous zebra crossing. As you strike the pose, a professional photographer captures your moment in Beatles history. Push open the heavy doors of Abbey Road Studios, where the familiar scent of aged wood and polished brass transports you back in time. Run your fingers along the smooth keys of the grand piano that birthed Lady Madonna , its notes resonating with McCartney's touch. In Studio Two, the vintage mixing console's knobs and dials sit ready, as if waiting for the next session. Close your eyes and almost hear the harmonies of A Day in the Life floating through the space where revolutionary recording techniques transformed music forever.

dayInfo.title: London - From Bohemian Soho to Chelsea's Fashion Scene
dayInfo.description: Morning sunlight filters through Soho's narrow streets as you step into a world where art changed history. In the space where the Indica Gallery once stood, the air still seems to crackle with creativity. Wind through Chelsea's cobblestone lanes, where leather and silk in boutique doorways evoke the revolution in fashion the Beatles inspired. As afternoon unfolds, lose yourself in Denmark Street's guitar shops. Explore the fretboards the band once tested, each instrument holding countless untold stories. In Soho's intimate record stores, vinyl crackles with possibility as you flip through history, searching for that elusive B-side.

dayInfo.title: London - From Apple Records to the British Library's Hidden Treasures
dayInfo.description: Visit 3 Savile Row, the elegant Georgian building that housed Apple Records. Head for the street where hundreds gathered on that cold January day in 1969 to witness the Beatles' final public performance on the rooftop. Stand in the heart of Mayfair, where the rumble of traffic mingles with echoes of the past as a recording of that final rooftop performance fills your ears, Get Back floating above the street just as it did that day. In the British Library's hushed sanctuary, see John's cramped handwriting crawling across aged paper, his cross-outs and scribbles revealing the birth of In My Life as Paul's Yesterday seems to whisper its evolution. As evening closes in, sink into the plush velvet of your theater seat. The first notes of Let It Be soar through the darkened space and, for a moment, you're transported to a London where four lads from Liverpool changed everything. Later, share stories with the performers, their faces alight with the same passion that drove the Beatles.

dayInfo.title: Liverpool - From Waterfront Dreams to the Cavern's Beat
dayInfo.description: The salt-tinged breeze of the Mersey welcomes you to Liverpool as your chauffeur winds through streets where maritime history meets rock 'n' roll legend. In The Beatles Story museum, the scent of leather transports you to the Cavern's early days, while the tinny sound of a vintage jukebox plays Love Me Do , just as it first crackled over radios in 1962. Feel the wooden boards creak beneath your feet in the reconstructed Hamburg club, where stage lights cast long shadows and the air seems thick with cigarette smoke and teenage dreams. As dusk settles over the Cavern Quarter, follow worn cobblestones to the Grapes Pub, where conversations echo off centuries-old brick. In the private dining room, take your place in a leather booth where John, Paul, George, and Ringo once huddled between sets. The warm glow of brass fixtures illuminates your guide's face as stories flow like the draft beer that once fueled four young musicians' ambitions. In this unchanged corner of history, the Beatles feel less like legends and more like local lads who just might walk through the door at any moment, guitars in hand and ready to change the world.

dayInfo.title: Liverpool - Through the Streets That Inspired the Songs
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, explore 12 Arnold Grove, where George's story began in a tiny two-up, two-down terraced house with an outside toilet, a humble beginning for the man who would introduce the Beatles to Eastern spirituality. Your guide will paint a vivid picture of post-war Liverpool life as you discover how the youngest Beatle's early years shaped his musical journey. Continue to the Welsh Streets, where Ringo's childhood unfolded between two modest homes, each telling its own story of the future drummer's resilient spirit. In the afternoon, descend into the Cavern Club's cocoon of cool, damp air and worn brick. The acoustics change as you go deeper â street sounds fade, replaced by echoes bouncing off the arched ceiling. The cellar's distinctive aroma, a mix of ancient stone and decades of music history, surrounds you. As night falls, follow the trail of music spilling from doorways. Modern songs blend with vintage melodies while neon lights paint the cobblestones. In each venue, feel the floor flex beneath dancing feet as bands chase their dreams in Beatles' birthplace.

dayInfo.title: Liverpool - Tracing George and Ringo's Humble Beginnings
dayInfo.description: Begin your morning in the leafy suburbs where Penny Lane will come alive before your eyes at the shelter in the middle of the roundabout, the barbershop, and the bank where the banker never wore a Mac in the pouring rain. Your guide will reveal how these everyday sights inspired one of the Beatles' most beloved songs, while a local photographer captures you recreating iconic moments. Continue to Strawberry Field, where the towering red gates that once captured young John's imagination now welcome visitors to explore the meticulously restored grounds and interactive exhibition that brings his connection to this former children's home to life. As afternoon light plays across the Liverpool waterfront, embark on a sculptural journey through Beatles history. Stand beside the larger-than-life bronzes of the young Beatles on the Pier Head, capture a moment with the contemplative Eleanor Rigby, and discover the stories behind these artistic tributes to Liverpool's favorite sons. As evening falls, join an intimate dinner with a renowned music historian to discover the lesser-known tales that shaped the band's journey from Liverpool locals to global icons.

dayInfo.title: London - Farewell Liverpool, hello London
dayInfo.description: Begin your final Liverpool morning at your own pace, perhaps seeking out vintage vinyl at the city's legendary music shops or exploring Liverpool ONE's mix of contemporary fashion and Beatles memorabilia. If you're eager for one last dive into the history of the port city that shaped the band's worldview, visit the Maritime Museum or enjoy a farewell stroll through the Royal Albert Dock's Victorian splendor. Your concierge can arrange private transfers to specialty shops or hidden musical landmarks you've yet to discover. Later, board your first-class carriage for a scenic railway journey south to London, following the path the Beatles took as fame called them to the capital. Settle into plush seats with champagne and refreshments as the English countryside rolls past. Upon arrival at your five-star London hotel, join your guide for a twilight orientation walk through the West End's glittering thoroughfares. Pass the sites of long-gone clubs where the Beatles first conquered London audiences, ending at a rooftop lounge where the city's lights twinkle below like diamonds in the night.

dayInfo.title: London - A Last Taste of Rock 'n' Roll London
dayInfo.description: Begin your final morning with a sumptuous farewell breakfast in your hotel's Victorian dining room. Over freshly baked pastries and hand-blended English teas, reflect on your journey through Beatles history. If you have an afternoon flight, take advantage of one last curated experience, perhaps visiting Keith Moon's favorite pub in Mayfair, exploring Jimi Hendrix's restored London flat, or making a pilgrimage to Freddie Mercury's Garden Lodge in Kensington. As you bid farewell to this wonderful city, you'll take with you a deeper connection to the four lads from Liverpool who changed popular music forever.
